textBeforeTable: Group Child Care Center Director A center director is responsible for the supervision of the center's program, the supervision of the staff, staff meetings, orientation and continuing education for the staff. Center Director must be at least 18 years of age, and meet one of the following three options: For FREE information on becoming a state licensed child care provider, contact your local PATCH office. For a listing of PATCH offices, click here. NOTE: consult the calendar page for the next FREE informational training session! Referring parents who are looking for child care to your business Giving you information about resources available to providers, such as the USDA Child Care Food Program that assists in paying for meals served in daycare Giving you information on child development, nutrition, health and safety issues Guiding you on setting up your child care business Assisting you in becoming licensed by the State of Hawaii PATCH can help you become a family child care provider by: Family Child Care Provider Are you interested in caring for children in your home? Are you able to provide that care in a safe and nurturing environment? Types of Early Care and Education Careers Click here to visit the HAEYC website. HAEYC is here to serve you, the early educator. If you have questions about your development as a professional, HAEYC can
textAfterTable: 12 months of full time experience working with children under 36 months in a licensed group care setting Opt.2 2 years college education in  early childhood/child development or related field 30 hours of I/T course work from accredited teacher training program/institute 24 months of full time experience working with children under 36 months in a licensed group care setting Group Child Care Center Teacher A child care teacher plans, implements and supervises the daily activities for a group of children. Teachers must be at least 18 years-old and must meet one of the following options: EDUCATION CREDITS EXPERIENCE Opt. 1 Degree in early childhood or child development from an accredited college or university   6 months of experience working with children Experience must be in an early care & education related setting Opt. 2 Bachelor Degree (any field) from an accredited college or university 12 credits in early childhood and/or child development 6 months of experience working with children Experience must be in an early care & education related setting Opt. 3 Bachelor Degree (elementary education) from an accredited college or university 6 credits in early childhood and/or child
